item.title: Destiny 2 Festival Of The Lost 2024: Start And End Dates, Rewards, And What's New
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/destiny-2-festival-of-the-lost-2024-start-and-end-dates-rewards-and-whats-new/1100-6527407/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Destiny 2's Festival of the Lost 2024 is right around the corner. Arriving a bit later than usual, Halloween's celebration across the solar system promises some interesting surprises, from new masks to a slight rework of the event compared to previous years. If you're wondering what the armor ornaments look like, developer Bungie has shared details about them, too.

Here's everything you can expect from Festival of the Lost 2024 in Destiny 2, including start times, masks, and the available rewards. We can't guarantee you'll be safe from jumpscares, though.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • Festival of the Lost 2024 start date
  • How to start Festival of the Lost 2024
  • Do you still need Spectral Pages in Festival of the Lost?
  • Festival of the Lost 2024 masks list
  • What else is new in Festival of the Lost 2024?
  • Festival of the Lost 2024 rewards

Festival of the Lost 2024 start date

Festival of the Lost 2024 is kicking off after the weekly Destiny 2 reset at 10 AM PT / 1 PM ET on October 29. The event comes to an end with the weekly reset on November 12.

It's a bit later compared to last year's edition, which started on October 17, but the scary vibes are the same.

How to start Festival of the Lost 2024

Eva Levante will return to Festival of the Lost. As in previous years, you'll stumble upon her in the Tower. After a quick introductory quest and some candy delivery, you'll be all set to start earning rewards and wearing some cool masks.

Do you still need Spectral Pages in Festival of the Lost?

If you were used to farming Spectral Pages, well, that's in the past. Bungie has announced that players no longer need to collect the item to complete chapters of the Book of the Forgotten. You only need Manifested Pages.

Alongside chests in Haunted Sectors, Manifested Pages will drop from "many different sources while you're wearing a mask," said Bungie. We'll have to wait until the event kicks off to confirm what the developer is referring to, although it's safe to assume it might be related to other activities aside from Haunted Sectors, which will come in handy.

Festival of the Lost 2024 masks list

It seems the celebrations around the release of Destiny 2 The Final Shape are still ongoing, as this year's Festival of the Lost is debuting seven new masks. Bungie also mentioned that masks found from Haunted Sectors will roll with higher stats, while the ones from Expert Haunted Sectors will have both high stats and "spikey rolls" with them.

Below is the list of masks in Festival of the Lost 2024 (official names TBC):

  • Cayde-6 Mask
  • Witness Mask
  • Tower Staff
  • Kadi 55-30 Mask
  • Thrall Mask
  • Runner Mask
  • Nezarec Mask
  • Ghost Mask

What else is new in Festival of the Lost 2024?

Alongside the removal of Spectral Pages, there are a few tweaks and additions worth considering before diving into Festival of the Lost 2024.

Like in previous years, in order to earn Eerie Engrams, Haunted Sectors are your best bet. Keep in mind that you'll be able to grab more Eerie Engrams in Expert Haunted Sectors, as they know have a chance to drop an additional engram.

In the weapons department, you can expect a familiar lineup of Festival of the Lost guns, only with updated perk pools. Bungie doesn't want to share too many details, except for a few perk combinations as a tease:

  • Mechabre (Aggressive Arc Sniper Rifle): Lone Wolf in column 3, Closing Time in column 4, and Search Party as the origin trait.
  • Jurassic Green (Rapid-Fire Solar Pulse): Loose Change in column 3, Incandescent in column 4, Search Party, Field Tested as origin traits.
  • Braytech Werewolf (Precision Kinetic Auto Rifle): Rewind Rounds in column 3, Onslaught in column 4, and Search Party as the origin trait.
  • Acosmic (Rapid-Fire Void Grenade Launcher): Withering Gaze in column 3, Bait and Switch in column 4, and Search Party, Nadie as the origin traits.

Also, you're now able to buy an Exotic class item directly from Eva, basically avoiding the need to complete the Dual Destiny quest in Destiny 2. For this, you'll need to own The Final Shape expansion, but know that you won't be able to attune the class items you buy from Eva. Unless you complete Dual Destiny, you'll only get random rolls. But hey, luck might be on your side.

Festival of the Lost 2024 rewards

Your candy-gathering efforts won't be for naught, as there'll be quite a few rewards to earn during Destiny 2's Halloween event.

Below are all of the Festival of the Lost 2024 rewards:

  • Wizard Armor Ornaments for a scary vibe.
  • The return of the Superblack shader.
  • Arcane Embrace as a new weapon: The shotgun has Arc element and a Heavy Burst subtype, so it fires a hard-hitting, two-round burst while slightly reducing flinching from incoming fire while aiming. As teased by Bungie, a potential combo for the weapon is Fourth Times the Charm in column 3, Precision Instrument in column 4, and Search Party in origin trait.
  • Lost Memento is also returning as a reward, and you'll be able to hold up to three at a time. You can earn it from completing the Twilight Triumph or as a random drop from focusing any items.
  • You can also earn the new Spectral Carapace emblem for completing the Twilight Triumph.

Have fun in this year's Festival of the Lost!

PS5 owners who haven't added the masterful Resident Evil 4 remake to their collection can grab a physical copy for cheap right now. Amazon has discounted Resident Evil 4 to only $20 for PS5. This is the lowest price ever for the PlayStation 5 physical edition. Resident Evil 4 carries a $40 retail price, though it's often available for $30-$35 at Amazon. Xbox Series X players can snag a physical copy for $22.

Resident Evil 4 continued Capcom's streak of successful Resident Evil remakes, recreating the 2005 original's story and setting with modernized visuals and gameplay that iterates on the design of the Resident Evil 2 and 3 remakes. However, unlike the massive overhauls seen in those other remakes, this new version of Resident Evil 4 is a much more faithful adaptation.

In GameSpot's Resident Evil 4 review, Kurt Indovina awarded the game a 10/10, saying that the remake "stands as a re-envisioning of its past rather than a replication of it. In doing this, it raises the bar for what a good remake is and at the same time, preserves Resident Evil 4's legacy as a genre-defining experience and one of the greatest games of all time."

It was the first of Capcom's Resident Evil remakes to receive a physical release for PS5, but soon it will have company. Capcom is releasing physical editions of the Resident Evil 2 and Resident Evil 3 remakes on January 10, 2025. Resident Evil 7 Gold Edition will also receive a physical release the same day, so now its direct sequel, Resident Evil Village, won't feel lonely on your shelf. All three games have free upgrades from PS4 to PS5, so many fans probably already have boxed copies for PS4. But if you like your game cases to match or simply want the actual physical edition for PS5, you can preorder the upcoming releases for $30 each at Best Buy.

Best Buy is running a massive three-day sale on gaming hardware, and one of the best deals in the bunch will save you $500 on the 14-inch HP Omen Transcend gaming laptop. The particular configuration sports Intel's new Core Ultra 7-155H CPU along with a GeForce RTX 4060 GPU, 16GB RAM, 1TB NVMe SSD, and crisp OLED screen, and you can pick it up for just $1,200 (down from $1,700) during Best Buy's sale.

While the laptop's specs can handle the latest AAA and indie games alike, the HP Omen Transcend's real draw is its 14-inch OLED screen. OLED screens offer better contrast ratios and more accurate black levels than LED panels. OLED laptop screen are uncommon--especially an OLED laptop for just $1,200.

The display also offers a 2.8K (2880x1800p) resolution and a high 120Hz refresh rate with VRR, which will make games look crisp and keep gameplay smooth--though, given the laptop's specs, you may have to fiddle with the in-game option to find the best settings. Along with the solid gaming performance, the screen sports flicker-free backlighting and low blue light output for less eye strain.

The rig's CPU is also of note. The Intel Core Ultra 7-155H is part of the brand's new line of premium mobile CPUs that launched earlier this year. This particular model is one of the higher-end chips in the line and offers strong performance and power efficiency, which means better-than-average battery life. In this case, the 14-inch HP Omen Transcend's battery lasts up to roughly 11 hours on a single charge and supports USB-C fast charging, which can restore up to 50% battery life in 30 minutes.

As a bonus, the laptop also comes with three free months of PC Game Pass, which gives you access to tons of games, including almost every Microsoft-published title that's released in the last few years. That even includes day-one access to upcoming first-party games launching on PC, like Indiana Jones And The Great Circle, Avowed, and Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024.

This HP Omen Transcend laptop is an excellent choice for those who prefer portable gaming rigs, especially at this lower price. However, it's not the only gaming laptop of note in Best Buy's 3-day sale. If you're looking for budget-friendly entry-level models, the MSI Thin 15.6-inch gaming laptop with 13th-gen Intel Core i5 CPU, GeForce RTX 4050, 16GB RAM, and 512GB SSD is down to just $600 (was $900). There's also the 15.6-inch Acer Nitro V laptop with an ‎Intel Core i7-13620H CPU, GeForce RTX 4060, 16GB RAN, and 512GB SSD for $800 (normally $1,100). Both laptops feature 1080p screens with 144Hz refresh rates. And those who have a bit more cash to spare could opt for the Asus ROG Zephyrus G14, which runs an AMD Ryzen 9 8000 CPU, GeForce RTX 4070, 32GB RAM, and 1TB SSD for $1,650 ($2,000).

You can check out even more deals on laptops, pre-built desktops, gaming monitors, and other hardware at Best Buy. The retailer's three-day gaming sale runs until Sunday, October 27.

item.title: Victrix's New Call Of Duty PS5 Controller Has Arrived, Last Year's Model Discounted
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/call-of-duty-black-ops-6-ps5-controller-victrix-pro-bfg/1100-6527081/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A whole bunch of Call of Duty merch launched alongside Black Ops 6 this week, including new collections of console and PC gear from SteelSeries and Corsair. But if you're specifically interested in picking up a Call of Duty-themed controller, the most notable new release is the Victrix Pro BFG's new Call of Duty Field Op Edition for PlayStation and PC. This is the latest special-edition variant of Victrix's superb modular controller, which is our favorite third-party gamepad for PS5.

The Victrix Pro BFG Field Op Edition is available for $200 at Amazon, but you'll also want to check out last year's Midnight Mask Edition, as Amazon has knocked $20 from its price to celebrate the launch of Black Ops 6. If you're interested in the Pro BFG after reading this article, it's worth noting the standard colors of the Pro BFG, white and black, are available for even less right now. The original black edition is only $145, while the white is $155. These normally retail for $20 less than the special editions at $180 each.

Victrix Pro BFG Call of Duty Editions for PS5, PS4, and PC

  • Call of Duty Field Op Edition -- $200 | New Release
  • Call of Duty Midnight Mask Edition (Blue Camo) -- $180 ($200)

More Victrix Pro BFG Controllers

  • Black -- $145 ($180)
  • White -- $155 ($180)
  • Tekken 8 -- $200

The Victrix Pro BFG is a modular controller that's easy to customize. With the included tool, you can quickly remove the faceplates covering the controls and shift the layout around. This allows you to have aligned analog sticks (PlayStation style) or offset (Xbox style). It also comes with four thumbstick caps, four stick grates, and three D-pad styles, including the solid square design shown above as well as more traditional eight- and four-way styles.

The right analog stick and face buttons can be swapped out for a six-button microswitch fight pad. Naturally, this won't be helpful for Call of Duty, but if you like fighting games, it's a great inclusion. It's worth noting Victrix also released a Tekken 8 Edition of the Pro BFG in July.

The Pro BFG also has four built-in back triggers that can be remapped on the fly and trigger locks for R2 and L2 with five different stopping points. You can save up to three custom profiles that can be cycled through on the fly.

You can also remap inputs using the Victrix Control Hub on PC. You have more control over your experience with the app, but unfortunately it's only available for PC. That said, adjustments save to the controller, so as long as you have a PC, you can still take advantage of features such as tweaking stick and trigger sensitivity, setting up analog stick dead zones, and adjusting the sound profile. The Pro BFG has built-in audio that gives you in-depth control over your headset audio experience. Keep in mind you'll need to connect your headset to the 3.5mm jack on the bottom of the controller.

The caveat to opting for a third-party PlayStation 5 controller is that you lose PlayStation's adaptive trigger and haptics tech as well as motion controls. If you're not okay with those losses, the only pro-style controller for you is PlayStation's DualSense Edge ($200). Some PS5 games make the DualSense's unique features a core component of the experience, including Astro Bot--you definitely want to play the PS5's wonderful platformer with a DualSense controller.

The Pro BFG offers substantially better battery life than DualSense controllers, though. You can get close to 20 hours on a full charge in our experience. And if you want a PlayStation controller with the ergonomics of an Xbox controller, the Pro BFG is the best option.

It syncs wireless to your PS5, PS4, and PC with a 2.4GHz USB dongle. Alternatively, you use the lengthy, braided USB to USB-C cable for a hardwired connection. All of the Pro BFG's accessories have dedicated slots inside the included hardshell carrying case.

The Pro BFG is also available in white and black models for Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, and PC for $180. It's one of our favorite pro-style Xbox controllers, but we'd also recommend checking out the new Razer Wolverine V3 Pro, which is the first wireless controller Razer has made for console.

item.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 - How To Unlock The Liberty Falls Easter Egg Song
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/call-of-duty-black-ops-6-how-to-unlock-the-liberty-falls-easter-egg-song/1100-6527406/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Treyarch's traditional, round-based Zombies returns in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 with two brand-new maps. Each map has a secret song you can unlock, and here we guide you through unlocking the secret song unique to the Liberty Falls map.

How to unlock the Liberty Falls Easter egg song

In order to play the secret song on Liberty Falls, you first need to find three hidden headphones. The headphones are blue and have fuzzy ears like the Mr. Peeks bunny. These can be interacted with in any order and at any time during your match. Press Square (PlayStation) or X (Xbox) depending on your platform.

Completing this Easter egg will play the new Zombies song called "Destroy Something Beautiful," which is composed by Kevin Sherwood.

Where to find Mr. Peeks headsets

The first headset you can encounter is on the left side of the map after opening up the barrier at the motel. Pass by the motel. You'll want to head up the small staircase beyond it and immediately turn right. The Mr. Peeks headset is sitting on the ground by the railing.

The next headset you'll likely cross paths with is near the Saving and Loan bank. At the back of the bank, which is near the staircase leading down to the comic book shop, you'll find a set of benches. The headset is on the ground underneath a bench.

Lastly, the third headset inside the Liberty Falls church with the Pack-a-Punch machine. Make your way to the top of the map, and head inside the church to find the headset sitting inside on a church pew.

The song will play once you've interacted with all three. You can do these steps once per match to play the song.

Here is the full guide for unlocking the secret song on Terminus. For more, check out our full guide on how loadouts work in Zombies and our guide for unlocking a secret loot vault on Liberty Falls.

item.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 - How To Unlock The Terminus Easter Egg Song
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/call-of-duty-black-ops-6-how-to-unlock-the-terminus-easter-egg-song/1100-6527405/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Treyarch's traditional, round-based Zombies returns in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6, and it also adds a classic Easter egg song for both launch maps. Here we guide you through unlocking the secret song for the Terminus map in BO6 Zombies.

How to unlock the Terminus Easter egg song

In order to play the secret song for Terminus, you first need to find three hidden headphones. The headphones are blue and have fuzzy ears like the mode's Mr. Peeks bunny. These can be interacted with in any order and at any time during your match. Press Square (PlayStation) or X (Xbox) depending on your platform.

Completing this Easter egg will play the new Zombies song called "Can You Hear Me Come In," which is composed by Kevin Sherwood.

Where to find Mr. Peeks headphones

The first set of headphones you'll encounter is not too far from the map's starting point. Pass through the guard station, and then head out the back of the building, as if you're still following the map's objective markers and the purple arrows leading to power.

This will lead you down a set of stairs, and there will be a corner with some barrels and the glow of a lantern. The headphones are sitting on top of a large wooden spool here.

Head down into the mine tunnels, and you'll want to be at the end of the tunnels near the PhD Flopper perk machine. The headset is sitting on top of a blue barrel across from the perk machine.

Lastly, the third headset is inside the Bio Lab. This is the large area with the Pack-a-Punch machine. The headset is in the office on the upper floor of the lab. You'll find it on top of some white cabinets.

The song will play once you've interacted with all three. You can do these steps once per match to play the song.

For more, check out our full guide on how loadouts work in Zombies. We also have Liberty Falls guides for locating the Pack-a-Punch machine and unlocking a secret loot vault.

item.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 - How Custom Loadouts Work In BO6 Zombies
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/call-of-duty-black-ops-6-how-custom-loadouts-work-in-bo6-zombies/1100-6527402/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 brings the return of Treyarch's traditional, round-based Zombies. There are two maps to choose from, with Liberty Falls being a more casual map and Terminus being a larger and more hardcore Zombies experience. No matter which map you choose, you'll want to make sure you're well-equipped. Here we explain everything you need to know when building a custom loadout.

How custom loadouts work in BO6 Zombies

Custom Zombies loadouts return. Just like in Black Ops Cold War, you'll load into matches with a weapon and equipment of your choosing. However, the loadout customization is a bit different than recent years.

You'll get one primary weapon slot. You can custom-build this gun with up to five attachments, assuming you have already leveled up the gun a bit and unlocked them.

Your loadout also comes with a dedicated melee slot. There are only two melee weapons in the game at launch. So, you can choose between a knife and a baseball bat.

Additionally, you can choose one piece of tactical equipment, lethal equipment, a Zombies field upgrade, and a pack of Gobblegums.

The actual guns you bring into the game won't be very powerful after the early rounds, and it costs a lot of points and salvage to level up that weapon's rarity and Pack-a-Punch. This is mostly a starter weapon, and thus the specific gun builds don't have to matter too much here.

You'll be better off investing in Wall Buys with higher rarities, Mystery Box guns, or even Wonder Weapons like the Ray Gun.

How to unlock Augments

Originally introduced in Black Ops Cold War, Augments are ways to make your field upgrades more powerful for your loadout, and they do the same for perks and ammo mods you purchase in-game.

Zombies matches get increasingly more difficult after round 25. The waves are more intense, and there are plenty of armored zombies that start to feel like bullet sponges. This is where Augments will become most beneficial. They'll give you added benefits such as extra health, increased movement speed, and immunity from fall damage.

You'll need to unlock Augments by completing Augment Research, which is a menu you won't have access to until you reach level 11. You'll want to make sure you start researching Augments as soon as you unlock the feature.

There are 108 total Augments in the game, with multiple major and minor Augments available for every perk, ammo mod, and field upgrade in the game. You can only research one Augment at a time, and unlocking them is painfully slow.

The Stamin-Up perk is a good starting point, as most of the powerful Augments are locked until you've researched a set amount of Augments. This includes the helpful Juggernog Augments that require you to research eight Augments before unlocking access to this research. Juggernog Augment research will be something you'll want to prioritize once you've unlocked it.

The full list and in-depth breakdown of all the Augments in the game can be found here.

Field Upgrade recommendations

At launch, Black Ops 6 includes the following field upgrades:

  • Aether Shroud: Phase into the Dark Aether, becoming hidden from enemy detection
  • Frenzied Guard: Repair armor and force all enemies in the area to target you. During this time, kills repair a portion of your armor
  • Healing Aura: Summons beams of energy down on yourself and allies to instantly revive and heal to full health
  • Energy Mine: Create a mine of pure energy that detonates in rapid succession, dealing lethal electric damage
  • Dark Flare: You generate a massive energy beam that deals lethal shadow damage. The beam penetrates everything in its path

There are a few really solid options here, depending on your playstyle and if you're playing with friends. It's usually good to have a mix of field upgrades for a full team.

For example: A medic role is important, so you probably want to have at least one player with Healing Aura, and Frenzied Guard is for the teammate who likes to be aggro and pull all the zombies towards them.

Aether Shroud is also a good choice for team play or solo matches, as going invisible for a short time can let you escape a sticky situation.

Dark Flare isn't the most team-friendly perk, but it is a lot of fun to use and deal out a ton of damage. Energy Mine is the least helpful and enjoyable option, so this is a bottom-tier pick that I wouldn't invest much in.

Gobblegum recommendations

Gobblegums return in Zombies, and these are powerful but temporary effects you can use. These are extremely optional. Some players prefer not to even use Gobblegums or things like Augments to make the game feel like a more classic Zombies experience.

However, here are some tips for making the most of your Gobblegums. Your loadout lets you customize a pack of five gums of various rarities, and you can earn more unique gums just by playing and completing rounds. You'll see an in-game popup every time you earn a new one.

I'd recommend grinding out some Zombies matches and saving up any powerful ones you earn for later matches, such as going for high-rounds or attempting an Easter egg.

These will be gums such as:

  • Perkaholic: Gives you all the perks on the map
  • Phoenix Up: Revives all downed teammates and lets them keep their perks
  • Wall Power: The next weapon you buy off the wall comes Pack-a-Punched
  • On The House: Spawns a random perk power-up that benefits you and your teammates

For more on Zombies, make sure to check out our Liberty Falls guides. This includes locating the Pack-a-Punch machine, as well as unlocking a secret loot vault.

item.title: Call Of Duty Zombies SteelSeries Gaming Headset Bundle Launches Alongside Black Ops 6
item.content:encoded:

To celebrate the return of the fan-favorite Zombies mode in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6, SteelSeries has announced an official Call of Duty: Zombies collaborative collection featuring special editions of several SteelSeries headsets and gaming accessories. The SteelSeries x Call of Duty: Zombies collection is available now, and each item includes a bonus code for exclusive in-game items. We've rounded up all the products below.

We recommend grabbing these SteelSeries X Call of Duty: Zombies edition devices as soon as possible. SteelSeries has launched several similar collabs in the past for other games like World of Warcraft and Destiny 2, and they almost always sell out fast. Considering the popularity of Call of Duty, chances are the SteelSeries X Call of Duty: Zombies edition collection will disappear soon.

SteelSeries Arctis Nova 7P headset bundle - Call of Duty: Zombies Edition

$240

The centerpiece item in the collab collection is the Call of Duty: Zombies Edition of SteelSeries' excellent Arctis Nova 7P PS5 headset. This special edition model is identical to the standard version in terms of specs and functionality, but features unique earcap and headband designs based on the Mister Peeks bunny from Call of Duty: Zombies. The bundle also includes a code for a Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 in-game weapon charm, a physical collectible card, and a set of KontrolFreek Deadshot Daiquiri Performance Thumbsticks, which are also part of the SteelSeries collab collection.

Like the standard Arctis 7P, the Call of Duty: Zombies Edition features Hi-Fi audio quality, 3D spatial audio support, a collapsible noise-canceling ClearCast Gen 2 mic, and up to 38 hours of battery life. It supports dual-audio stream playback thanks to simultaneous 2.4GHz and Bluetooth connections. It also uses the suspension headband and AirWeave memory foam ear cushions that make the Arctis 7P our favorite headset on the PS5. 7P also work on PC, Switch, and mobile.

SteelSeries Nova Booster Pack - Call of Duty: Zombies Mister Peeks Edition

$40

If you already own a SteelSeries Arctis Nova headset, you can customize it with this standalone booster pack that includes the Call of Duty: Zombies Edition Mister Peeks magnetic earcaps and headband. The accessories can be used with the Arctis Nova Pro, Nova 7, Nova 7P, or Nova 7X headsets. A code for an in-game weapon charm is also included.

QcK L - Call of Duty: Zombies Edition

$30

For PC players, SteelSeries has a Call of Duty: Zombies Edition of its large QcK L mousepad. The pad features a micro-woven cloth playing surface and non-slip rubber base. It measures roughly 18 inches long, 16 inches wide, and just 2mm tall.

The Call of Duty: Zombies Edition QcK L mousepad comes with an in-game weapon charm for Black Ops 6.

KontrolFreek x Call of Duty Performance Thumbsticks - Deadshot Daiquiri Edition

The last accessory in the SteelSeries X Call of Zombies collection is a set of thumbstick tops from the SteelSeries-owned company KontrolFreaks. These rubberized pads clip onto the top of your controller's thumbsticks, adding extra grip and height for more precise movements. The design is based on the Deadshot Daiquiri powerup from Call of Duty: Zombies.

There are Xbox and PlayStation versions of the thumbsticks available, and both variants come in either a $20 standard edition or $30 Collector's Edition that includes a replica Deadshot Daiquiri drink can.

More Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Gaming Hardware

If you're looking for even more official Black Ops 6 gaming tech, Corsair has its own collection of Call of Duty PC gaming hardware that includes pre-built desktop PCs, gaming laptops, keyboards, mice, and streaming gear. There's also the new Call of Duty-themed Victrix Pro BFG modular PS5 controller that also launched today and is available at Amazon. And in case you need even more Call of Duty merch, the Call of Duty Shop has released Black Ops 6 shirts, hoodies, and more.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 launched today, October 25, on PC, PlayStation, and Xbox. If you're looking to track down the game on launch day, be sure to check out our preorder guide, which has links to all the versions of the game available at online retailers.

item.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 Twitch Drops And How To Get Them

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 has arrived, and you can earn some in-game loot via Twitch Drops by watching eligible Twitch streams. The Twitch campaign runs until November 13, with four items up for grabs, including a weapon blueprint. In order to get these drops, you will need to watch Twitch streams of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 where the creator has enabled drops.

Black Ops 6 Twitch Rewards

There are four items up for grabs: the XMG Get Wiped blueprint, Never Broken calling card, Azurite Vision charm, and the Deflected emblem. Most of these rewards are purely cosmetic, although the XMG blueprint can be used in-game, letting you access attachments for the weapon before you might have unlocked them by leveling up. Each of these items has a specific hour count you need to hit.

  • Deflected emblem - 1 Hour
  • Never Broken calling card - 2 Hours
  • Azurite Vision - 3 Hours
  • XMG Get Wiped blueprint - 4 Hours

You can check your progress by navigating to your profile icon on Twitch and going down in the drop menu to Drops and Rewards, which is also where you can claim these items once you earn them. Before you can start earning these drops, you need to make sure your Twitch account and Activision account have been linked. If your account isn't connected, there is a connect option in the Drops and Rewards screen under the Black Ops 6 campaign, which will take you to the Activision website, where you can log in and connect the two accounts.

Once you have successfully connected your accounts, the connect link will no longer be on that page. From there, just head to the Black Ops 6 category on Twitch and look for the tag DropsEnabled to find a stream to watch. You will need to collect your rewards from the Drops and Rewards menu once you have met the time requirements.

For more help with Black Ops 6, check out our Best Weapon Loadouts and Best Perks guides.
